title: Game client should alert you if you are banning a teammate's pick intent
body: No idea why this feature isn't in the game already. If you're banning another teammate's champion, the client should popup with a simple yes/no "A teammate has pick intnted XXX. Are you sure you want to ban XXX?". Also extend the time allowed to ban for 5 seconds the first time that alert pops up in case somebody needs to panic ban.

replies.body: People who ban an allies intent-pick aren't going to care. They know exactly what they're doing most of the time.
But sometimes you don't notice and ban it by accident. Even if most such bans were intentional, having a little warning would be worth it.

I can attest to banning other's picks by accident. I'll be watching YouTube when league pops up, and within 3 seconds I ban Cait (I hate her, as a Skarner player).

Then they get real pissy and say "we would have won if I had Cait", and if you won, "we would have won 5 minutes earlier if I had Cait".

Tbh, if I ban a persons pick intend by accident (let's say our mid wants Zed and I always ban Zed so routine kicks in) and they just have the manners to calmly ask why I will clear it up and dodge. My fault, my LP, my leaverbuster.
"I wouldn't gotten a pentakill if I had Cait, reported"

Naturally we lost the game. Picked Syndra (they couldn't have banned my Championpool even if 6 players tried to)  and didn't let LB snowball. The duo botlane went Shaco support with TP and ignite. Wasn't worth the rage, I just kept silent about it.

Good idea but the extension may be a problem. Since the enemy sees what champ you're hovering to ban an extra 5 seconds would let them know what champ you have on your team. It could also work so someone on your team hovers yasuo who isn't gonna play him. You hover ban yasuo then decline and ban teemo. The enemy will now think you have a yasuo on your team when you don't and they will ban him. If the 5 sec rule could be fixed up or removed it is a perfect idea in my opinion.

How about they completely get rid of the hover-over, then?  Because wtf is the hover over even there?  It just encourages people to take longer at champ select by cycling through 900 meaningless picks before they finally pick the champ they intended to get all along.

I get pretty suspicious when the banner of my champion responds that they weren't paying attention, when I ask whether they banned my champion on purpose.

I agree, there should be a popup, so absent-minded people won't accidentally ban their team's picks.
Or the assholes who purposely ban won't have an excuse, since they have to click "Yes, I am aware that I am banning an allies pick intent".

The best idea would be for people to realize that if they are 3-5th pick and their team doesn't have first pick (to trade), then they shouldn't pick intent pick/ban champions.  But so many times the next to last guy will hover Camille or Yasuo, then our team will leave them open so they aren't assholes only to have the enemy team first pick them and dump on their lane.  

Basically, the best thing here would be for people to realize that they shouldn't hover a pick/ban champion unless they or their team has first pick and can trade.  If you're that guy, stop doing that.  If your team can't first pick Camille for you, don't hover her as the 4th pick on your team.  Thanks.
